activatingEvent: This morning my boss said he needs a detailed project report by tomorrow. I immediately thought it would be very difficult.
belief: If I cannot complete the report properly on time, I am a failure and people will think I am incompetent.
consequencesPsychological: Repeated thoughts like 'I am a failure', poor concentration
consequencesPhysical: Fast heartbeat, stomach discomfort, reduced sleep
dispute: Does one report really define my entire ability? I have done well before, and it is okay to ask for help.
emotionalEffect: Some relief; a small sense of hope
psychologicalEffect: Fewer negative thoughts; a 'I will try' mindset
behaviouralEffect: Breaking the report into small steps; asking a colleague for feedback
note: Break work into small tasks; follow the 60-minute work + 5-minute break rule.

activatingEvent: During an interview I became nervous and forgot some words.
belief: I am always nervous; I am not suitable for this position.
dispute: A little nervousness in one interview does not measure my full ability; I can improve with practice.
psychologicalEffect: Reduced negative thinking; motivation to prepare for the next interview
behaviouralEffect: Doing mock interviews; practicing breathing exercises
note: Practice breathing exercises and posture for 5â€“10 minutes daily.

activatingEvent: A friend read my message but did not reply.
belief: They are angry with me or have lost interest in me.
dispute: People are sometimes busy; not replying to one message does not automatically mean rejection.
behaviouralEffect: Following up gently after some time
note: Delays happen due to busy schedules. Send a light follow-up after 24 hours.

activatingEvent: I made a mistake during a presentation and people laughed.
belief: I should feel ashamed; I made a fool of myself.
dispute: Mistakes are normal; people usually react briefly and then forget.
behaviouralEffect: Learning from mistakes and preparing better next time
note: After every presentation, write down at least one positive feedback.

activatingEvent: I received a test result that was lower than expected.
belief: I am not intelligent; I will not succeed in the future.
dispute: One test does not reflect my full ability; making a plan to improve is more helpful.
behaviouralEffect: Revising and creating a study plan
note: Create a clear study plan for the next two weeks with small achievable goals.
